member.name: D3D12_FEATURE_DATA_VIDEO_ENCODER_CODEC_CONFIGURATION_SUPPORT
member.summary: Provides data for calls to when the feature specified is . Retrieves a value indicating if the specified codec configuration support parameters are supported for the provided HEVC encoding configuration or retrieves the supported configuration for H.264 encoding.

member.name: D3D12_FEATURE_DATA_VIDEO_ENCODER_CODEC_CONFIGURATION_SUPPORT.NodeIndex
member.summary: In multi-adapter operation, this indicates which physical adapter of the device this operation applies to.

member.name: D3D12_FEATURE_DATA_VIDEO_ENCODER_CODEC_CONFIGURATION_SUPPORT.Codec
member.summary: A member of the enumeration specifying the codec for which rate control mode support is being queried.

member.name: D3D12_FEATURE_DATA_VIDEO_ENCODER_CODEC_CONFIGURATION_SUPPORT.Profile
member.summary: A structure specifying the profile for which intra refresh mode support is being queried.

member.name: D3D12_FEATURE_DATA_VIDEO_ENCODER_CODEC_CONFIGURATION_SUPPORT.IsSupported
member.summary: Receives a boolean value indicating if the specified configuration parameters are supported for the specified codec.

member.name: D3D12_FEATURE_DATA_VIDEO_ENCODER_CODEC_CONFIGURATION_SUPPORT.CodecSupportLimits
member.summary: A structure. For HEVC, the caller populates this structure with the desired encoder configuration. For H.264, the CheckFeatureSupport call populates the structure with the supported configuration.
